templates.template: Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP
templates.name: Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP
templates.description:
This template monitors Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) autonomous database (serverless) resources.

This template is not meant to be used independently, but together with Oracle Cloud by HTTP as a template for
LLD host prototypes.

Read the template documentation prior to using this template.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Database availability
items.description: The database is available for connections in the given minute.

triggers.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.availability) = 0
triggers.name: Database is not available

dependencies.name: Database is not available or accessible
dependencies.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 19 or last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 20

items.name: DB block changes
items.description:
The number of changes that were part of an update or delete operation that were made to all blocks in the SGA.
Such changes generate redo log entries and thus become permanent changes to the database if the transaction is committed.
This statistic approximates total database work and indicates the rate at which buffers are being dirtied during the selected time interval.

items.name: Failed connections
items.description: The number of failed database connections.

items.name: CPU time
items.description: Average rate of accumulation of CPU time by foreground sessions in the database over the selected time interval.

items.name: CPU utilization, in %
items.description: The CPU usage expressed as a percentage, aggregated across all consumer groups. The utilization percentage is reported with respect to the number of CPUs the database is allowed to use.

triggers.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.cpu.util,5m) >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.CPU.UTIL.WARN}
triggers.name: Current CPU utilization is high
triggers.description: Current CPU utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.CPU.UTIL.WARN}`% of the max available value.

dependencies.name: Current CPU utilization is too high
dependencies.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.cpu.util,5m) >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.CPU.UTIL.HIGH}

triggers.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.cpu.util,5m) >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.CPU.UTIL.HIGH}
triggers.name: Current CPU utilization is too high
triggers.event_name: Current CPU utilization is too high (util >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.CPU.UTIL.HIGH}%)
triggers.description: Current CPU utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.CPU.UTIL.HIGH}`% of the max available value.

items.name: Execute count
items.description: The number of user and recursive calls that executed SQL statements during the selected time interval.

items.name: Connection latency
items.description: The time taken to connect to an Oracle Autonomous Database Serverless instance in each region from a Compute service virtual machine in the same region.

items.name: Query latency
items.description: The time taken to display the results of a simple query on the user's screen.

items.name: Session logical reads
items.description: The sum of `db block gets` and `consistent gets` during the selected time interval. This includes logical reads of database blocks from either the buffer cache or process private memory.

items.name: Current logons
items.description: The number of successful logons during the selected time interval.

items.name: Failed logons
items.description: The number of logons that failed because of an invalid user name and/or password during the selected time interval.

items.name: Get frequent metrics
items.description: Gets all metrics related to the database that have a collection frequency of 1 minute.

items.name: Get database stats
items.description: Gets all metrics related to specific database that have a collection frequency of 5 minutes.

items.name: Get storage stats
items.description: Gets all storage metrics related to a specific database that have a collection frequency of 60 minutes.

items.name: Parse count (failures)
items.description: The number of parse failures during the selected time interval.

items.name: Parse count (hard)
items.description: The number of parse calls (real parses) during the selected time interval. A hard parse is an expensive operation in terms of memory use as it requires Oracle to allocate a workheap and other memory structures and then build a parse tree.

items.name: Parse count (total)
items.description: The number of hard and soft parses during the selected time interval.

items.name: Physical read total bytes
items.description: The size in bytes of disk reads by all database instance activity including application reads, backup and recovery, and other utilities during the selected time interval.

items.name: Physical reads
items.description: The number of data blocks read from disk during the selected time interval.

items.name: Physical write total bytes
items.description: The size in bytes of all disk writes for the database instance including application activity, backup and recovery, and other utilities during the selected time interval.

items.name: Physical writes
items.description: The number of data blocks written to disk during the selected time interval.

items.name: Queued statements
items.description: The number of queued SQL statements aggregated across all consumer groups during the selected time interval.

items.name: Redo generated
items.description: Amount of redo generated in bytes during the selected time interval.

items.name: Sessions
items.description: The number of sessions in the database.

items.name: Bytes received via SQL*Net from client
items.description: The number of bytes received from the client over Oracle Net Services during the selected time interval.

items.name: Bytes received via SQL*Net from DBLink
items.description: The number of bytes received from a database link over Oracle Net Services during the selected time interval.

items.name: Bytes sent via SQL*Net to client
items.description: The number of bytes sent to the client from the foreground processes during the selected time interval.

items.name: Bytes sent via SQL*Net to DBLink
items.description: The number of bytes sent over a database link during the selected time interval.

items.name: State
items.description: Gets the autonomous database state.

parameters:
const idx = {
	'PROVISIONING': 1,
	'AVAILABLE': 2,
	'STOPPING': 3,
	'STOPPED': 4,
	'STARTING': 5,
	'TERMINATING': 6,
	'TERMINATED': 7,
	'RESTORE_IN_PROGRESS': 8,
	'RESTORE_FAILED': 9,
	'BACKUP_IN_PROGRESS': 10,
	'SCALE_IN_PROGRESS': 11,
	'AVAILABLE_NEEDS_ATTENTION': 12,
	'UPDATING': 13,
	'MAINTENANCE_IN_PROGRESS': 14,
	'RESTARTING': 15,
	'RECREATING': 16,
	'ROLE_CHANGE_IN_PROGRESS': 17,
	'UPGRADING': 18,
	'UNAVAILABLE': 19,
	'INACCESSIBLE': 20,
	'STANDBY': 21
};

return typeof idx[value] === 'undefined' ? 0 : idx[value];

triggers.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 12
triggers.name: Available, needs attention
triggers.description: Autonomous database is available, but needs attention.

triggers.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 19 or last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 20
triggers.name: Database is not available or accessible
triggers.description: Autonomous database is not available or accessible.

triggers.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 9
triggers.name: Restore has failed

triggers.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state,#1)<>last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state,#2)
triggers.name: State has changed

dependencies.name: Available, needs attention
dependencies.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 12

dependencies.name: Database is not available or accessible
dependencies.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 19 or last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 20

dependencies.name: Restore has failed
dependencies.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 9

dependencies.name: State unknown
dependencies.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 0

triggers.expression: last(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.state) = 0
triggers.name: State unknown

items.name: Running statements
items.description: The number of running SQL statements aggregated across all consumer groups during the selected time interval.

items.name: Storage space allocated
items.description: Amount of space allocated to the database for all tablespaces during the selected time interval.

items.name: Maximum storage space
items.description: Maximum amount of storage reserved for the database during the selected time interval.

items.name: Storage space used
items.description: Maximum amount of space used during the selected time interval.

items.name: Storage utilization, in %
items.description: The percentage of the reserved maximum storage currently allocated for all database tablespaces. Represents the total reserved space for all tablespaces.

triggers.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.storage.space.util,5m) >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.STORAGE.UTIL.WARN}
triggers.name: Current storage utilization is high
triggers.description: Current storage utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.STORAGE.UTIL.WARN}`% of the max available value.

dependencies.name: Current storage utilization is too high
dependencies.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.storage.space.util,5m) >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.STORAGE.UTIL.HIGH}

triggers.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Autonomous Database by HTTP/oci.aut.db.storage.space.util,5m) >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.STORAGE.UTIL.HIGH}
triggers.name: Current storage utilization is too high
triggers.event_name: Current storage utilization is too high (util >= {$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.STORAGE.UTIL.HIGH}%)
triggers.description: Current storage utilization has exceeded `{$OCI.AUTONOMOUS.DB.STORAGE.UTIL.HIGH}`% of the max available value.

items.name: DB time
items.description:
The amount of time database user sessions spend executing database code (CPU time + wait time). Database time is used to infer database call latency as it increases in direct proportion to both database call latency (response time) and call volume.
It is calculated as the average rate of accumulation of database time by foreground sessions in the database over the selected time interval.

items.name: Transaction count
items.description: The combined number of user commits and user rollbacks during the selected time interval.

items.name: User calls
items.description: The combined number of logons, parses, and execute calls during the selected time interval.

items.name: User commits
items.description: The number of user commits during the selected time interval. When a user commits a transaction, the generated redo that reflects the changes made to database blocks must be written to disk. Commits often represent the closest thing to a user transaction rate.

items.name: User rollbacks
items.description: Number of times users manually issue the `ROLLBACK` statement or an error occurs during a user's transactions during the selected time interval.

items.name: Wait time
items.description: Average rate of accumulation of non-idle wait time by foreground sessions in the database over the selected time interval.

macros.description: Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "high" severity event about CPU resource utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "warning" severity event about CPU resource utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "high" severity event about storage resource utilization.
Sets the percentage threshold for creating a "warning" severity event about storage resource utilization.
Set an HTTP proxy for OCI API requests if needed.
Set the HTTP return code that represents an OK response from the API. The default is "200",  but can vary, for example, if a proxy is used.
